intro: Phoradendron saltillense, commonly known as the saltillense mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the Viscaceae family. It primarily grows on the branches of oak and other broadleaf trees, forming dense, spherical clusters. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are typically covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are dispersed by birds. The species is native to Mexico and is characterized by its unique ecological relationship with its host trees.
